source_sentence: 佛言：「諸仁者！
translation: The Buddha said, "Gentlemen!

source_sentence: 如是等佛，於此四天下國土、城邑、村落、山林處處而現，我今神力之所加故，還有如是等數塔寺，於彼彼處，我諸聲聞現在未來三業相應，及與三種菩提相應有學無學具足持戒多聞善行，度諸眾生於三有海，及諸施主為我聲聞而造塔寺，亦復供給一切所須，及彼眷屬付囑汝等，勿令惡王非法惱亂。
translation: Thus, these buddhas appear everywhere in these four worlds as lands, cities, villages, and mountains, and as a result of my miraculous powers, there are such-and-such number of stūpas and temples where our śrāvakas are present, future, and associated with the three kinds of enlightenment, both learned and unlearned, fully observe precepts, are well-versed in good conduct, save sentient beings in the ocean of the three existences, and where our benefactors build stūpas and temples for our śrāvakas, provide for whatever is needed, and entrust you with their retinues, so that you don't allow evil kings to unlawfully disturb you.

source_sentence: 「又復，勿令他方冤敵、盜賊、水火、人、非人等之所恐怖，亦勿令彼飢渴乏少，以乏少故於三善業不得相應，退捨禁戒善朋損減。」
translation: "Furthermore, don't cause enemies, thieves, fire and water, humans, and non-humans in other places to become frightened, and don't cause them to become hungry and thirsty and lacking, so that lacking them, they won't be able to associate with the three good actions and will retreat from the precepts and have their good friends diminished."

source_sentence: 爾時，復有諸梵天王、諸釋天王、諸龍王、諸夜叉王、諸阿修羅王、諸鳩槃荼王，皆與眷屬合掌向佛，而作是言：「大德婆伽婆！
translation: At the time, there were also Brahmadeva, Śakra, Nāga, Yakṣa, Asura, and Kumbhâṇḍa kings who joined their hands with their followers and approached the Buddha, saying, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 已有一切如來塔寺及阿蘭若處，現在世尊聲聞弟子所有住處，及未來世剎利、婆羅門、毘舍、首陀，若在家人、若出家人，為於世尊聲聞弟子造塔寺處，隨有世尊聲聞弟子三業相應，及與三種菩提相應，有學無學住於持戒多聞善行，我等悉共守護於彼，令離一切諸難怖畏。
translation: "Regarding all the tathāgatas' stūpas and araṇya places that exist now and all the present dwelling places of the Bhagavān's śrāvaka disciples, as well as those of bhadras, brāhmaṇas, piśatas, and śuddhas of future generations, whether living or retired, who will build stūpas and araṇya places for the Bhagavān's śrāvaka disciples, we will all guard them together, freeing them from all kinds of difficult fears.

source_sentence: 諸有世尊聲聞弟子所立塔寺及阿蘭若處，如有給施飲食、衣服、臥具、湯藥一切所須，如是施主我等亦當護持養育。
translation: If the Bhagavān's śrāvaka disciples erect stūpas and araṇya places, and if they give food, drink, clothing, bedding, and medicine for everything that's needed, we will also guard and nurture such benefactors.

source_sentence: 若復世尊聲聞弟子，乏少晝夜所須眾具貧苦之者，我為彼等作大施主，受其寄付護持養育除諸怖畏。」
translation: If another disciple of the Bhagavān or śrāvaka lacks the necessities of day and night and is poor, I'll be a great benefactor for them and accept their entrustment, supporting and nurturing them to remove their fears."

source_sentence: 佛時讚言：「善哉，善哉！
translation: The Buddha then praised them, saying, "Good, good!

source_sentence: 諸賢首！
translation: Chief of the Bhadras!

source_sentence: 汝等一切於四天下應當如是，如今汝等受我教勅如說修行，我以汝等及諸眷屬付囑彌勒。」
translation: All of you in the four worlds should do likewise. Now, you have been instructed by me to practice as I've taught you, and I've entrusted Maitreya with you and your retinues."

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊欲重明此義而說偈言：「天王皆悉起，　　敬禮瞿曇仙，　問諸塔寺數，　　說佛所依處。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān wanted to explain this meaning again and spoke the verse, "The god kings all rose up, paid homage to the Gautama sage, asked how many stūpas and temples there were, and told him where the Buddha relies.

source_sentence: 於此四天下，　　復有幾塔寺？
translation: How many more stūpas and temples are there in these four heavens?

source_sentence: 聲聞所依者，　　我等共護持。
translation: "Those who are relied upon by the śrāvakas are protected by us all.

source_sentence: 兩足尊微笑，　　於此四天下，　化作諸佛現，　　無量百千數，　四方神力加，　　故現諸化佛。
translation: Smiling, the Two-Footed Honored One conjures up buddha appearances in these four heavens that are numberless and hundreds of thousands in number, and with the help of spiritual powers in four directions, he conjures up transformation buddhas.

source_sentence: 示佛諸聲聞，　　所立諸塔寺，　為住三乘道，　　是故而建立。
translation: The stūpas and temples that the śrāvakas erect to show the buddhas how to abide in the path of the three vehicles are built for that reason.

source_sentence: 樂三業相應，　　如是聲聞住，　以諸聲聞寺，　　付囑於汝等，　供養彼施主，　　亦當護養育，　不令相違惱，　　勿使他得便，　莫令有乏少，　　退捨於禁戒。
translation: Concomitant with the three activities, these śrāvakas thus abide, and the śrāvaka temples are entrusted to you to support their benefactors and nurture them so that you won't be disrupted, don't allow others to get an advantage, and don't allow any to lack or abstain from observing the precepts.

source_sentence: 天王及眷屬，　　稟受佛教勅，　我等悉護彼，　　導師所建立，　我等及眷屬，　　勤護諸塔寺。
translation: We protect them all, the guiding teachers who build them, and we and our retinues diligently guard the stūpas and temples that have been built and will be built by them.

source_sentence: 已作當作者，　　一切勤護持，　知足諸比丘，　　住於無積聚，　離欲慈悲心，　　我等當守護。」
translation: We will diligently safeguard all those who have done and will do so, knowing that the monks abide in a nonaggregate, free of desire and compassionate mind, and we will guard them."

source_sentence: 大集經月藏分第十二法滅盡品第二十爾時，月藏菩薩摩訶薩復從座起，整理衣服偏袒右肩，合掌向於十方一切諸來菩薩摩訶薩眾，口眼微笑顧視月燈菩薩摩訶薩，而說偈言：「觀此希有慈悲士，　　釋迦大仙尊導師，　今以此法甘露味，　　付囑夜叉令護持，　普告一切作是言，　　我之正法汝當護。
translation: At the time, the Yuezang Bodhisattva Mahāsattva rose from his seat, adjusted his robes, bared his right shoulder, put his palms together, faced all the bodhisattvas and mahāsattvas in the ten directions, smiled with his mouth and eyes, looked at the Yuezang Bodhisattva Mahāsattva, and spoke the verse, "Look at this rare and compassionate man, the honored guide of Śākyamuni, who now gives this Dharma the taste of ambrosia and entrusts it to the yakṣas to guard, and tells all of them to say this, 'You must guard my right Dharma.

source_sentence: 一切聲聞器非器，　　當視如子護養育，　為我剃頭著袈裟，　　勿令於後有惱害，　休息諸惡儉病疫，　　亦息非時風熱雨。
translation: All śrāvakas and non-vakings should be treated like sons, nurtured, shave their heads and put on their robes for me, so that they won't be harmed later, rest from bad frugality, disease, and epidemics, and quell unseasonable winds and hot rains.

source_sentence: 如是三種精氣增，　　正法久住於世間，　眾生不墮諸惡道，　　速能趣向大涅槃。
translation: Thus, when these three kinds of energy increase, the right teaching will long remain in the world, sentient beings won't fall into bad destinies, and they'll quickly reach the great nirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 我從昔來未見聞，　　慈悲希有餘土無，　除佛更無餘眾生，　　能令正法久熾然。
translation: I've never seen or heard of them since the distant past, but there are few compassionate, rare, or other lands, and there are no other sentient beings besides buddhas who can make the right Dharma long blazing.

source_sentence: 諸佛慈悲慧無量，　　廣持正法令久住，　導師滅後佛正法，　　熾然久住事希有。
translation: The compassion and wisdom of the buddhas are immeasurable, and they extensively maintain the right Dharma for a long time. It's rare for the Buddha's right Dharma to blaze and long-lasting after the disappearance of a guide.

source_sentence: 此土不善煩惱山，　　堅固希有最難壞，　轉正梵輪法眼住，　　悉令住善到涅槃。
translation: This land's mountain of unwholesome afflictions is so sturdy and rare that it's hard to destroy. Turning the right Brahmā wheel, the Dharma eye abides, and it always makes abiding good and reaching nirvāṇa possible.

source_sentence: 此土極惡人與魔，　　夜叉修羅鳩槃荼，　彼等究竟滅煩惱，　　護持世尊真妙法。
translation: The most unwholesome people and demons of this land, the yakṣas, sūras, and kumbhâṇḍas, thoroughly extinguish their afflictions and uphold the Bhagavān's true and wonderful teaching.

source_sentence: 以是因緣得最勝，　　能盡所作諸惡業，　彼勤供養於三寶，　　是故速能趣涅槃。
translation: Because of these causes and conditions, they attain supremacy, ending the bad actions they perform and diligently making offerings to the Three Treasures, they're quickly headed for nirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 斷除煩惱牟尼尊，　　世間自在大導師，　憐愍一切眾生故，　　告令護持佛正法。」
translation: The Venerable Muni, who has ended the afflictions and is the world's self-contained great teacher, has compassion for all sentient beings and tells them to safeguard the Buddha's true teaching."

source_sentence: 爾時，月燈菩薩摩訶薩聞月藏菩薩說是偈已，復說偈言：「我欲問佛無邊慧，　　法眼幾時住於世，　如此佛月滅度後，　　煩惱癡諍闇世間。
translation: After hearing this verse from Mochizang, the Candra Bodhisattva Mahāsa heard it again and spoke the verse, "I want to ask the Buddha about his limitless wisdom, 'When did the Dharma eye abide in the world?' After the Buddha's moon ceased, the world was darkened by afflictions and delusions.

source_sentence: 云何賢聖復得集，　　當作何人方便護？
translation: How could good men and sages again gather, and who should they be to guard them skillfully?'

source_sentence: 云何示世安隱道，　　能度三趣億眾生？」
translation: How does it reveal the peaceful path of the world, which can save billions of sentient beings in the three destinies?"

source_sentence: 爾時，一切諸來大眾，向諸菩薩摩訶薩讚言：「善哉，善哉！」
translation: At that point, all the people who had come praised the bodhisattvas and mahāsattvas, saying, "Good, good!"

source_sentence: 爾時，月燈菩薩摩訶薩從座而起，偏袒右肩整理衣服，右膝著地，合掌向佛頭面作禮，以偈問曰：「我今問佛無邊慧，　　以我今有諸疑網，　以何因緣法眼滅，　　云何法燈久熾然？
translation: At that point, the Candra Bodhisattva Mahāsattva rose from his seat, adjusted his robes with his right shoulder bared, knelt on his right knee, saluted the Buddha with his palms together at his head and face, and asked in a verse, "Now, I've asked the Buddha about his infinite wisdom, because I have this web of doubt, what are the causes and conditions for the cessation of the Dharma eye, and how has the Dharma lamp remained blazing for so long?

source_sentence: 誰能破壞此法鼓？
translation: Who can destroy this dharma-drum?

source_sentence: 誰能枯涸正法河？
translation: Who can dry up the river of the true dharma?

source_sentence: 云何法眼得久住？
translation: How can the Dharma eye be sustained for a long time?

source_sentence: 我當於彼助護持。
translation: "I will help to maintain it there.

source_sentence: 為以尸羅精進力，　　為以羼提禪般若，　為以何力法久住？
translation: By the power of Śīlabhadra's effort, by the wisdom of diligent meditation, by what power will the Dharma last forever?

source_sentence: 唯願速說何方便。
translation: "Please tell us quickly what teaching to use.

source_sentence: 云何法水得久流？
translation: How can the water of the Dharma flow for a long time?

source_sentence: 有多億數助佛者，　我等精勤堅固行，　　為令法海不速竭。
translation: There are billions of people who aid the Buddha, and we diligently and resolutely practice so that the ocean of the Dharma won't be quickly dried up.

source_sentence: 大地精味常增長，　　及以眾生法精味，　枯涸眾生煩惱海，　　眾生更不趣惡道。」
translation: The essential taste of the earth always increases, and with the essential taste of the Dharma in sentient beings, the ocean of their afflictions is dried up, and sentient beings are no longer led to a bad path."

source_sentence: 爾時，佛申金色右臂而說偈言：「汝等共諦聽，　　一切有為法，　無常火所燒，　　無有少常者。
translation: At that point, the Buddha extended his golden right arm and spoke the verse, "Listen closely, all of you, for all created things are burned by impermanent fire, and there's nothing less permanent than that.

source_sentence: 譬如諸戲人，　　作於種種戲，　如是等眾生，　　皆為煩惱轉。
translation: Like playmakers who engage in various kinds of play, such sentient beings are all transformed by affliction.

source_sentence: 猶如幻芭蕉，　　亦如水中月，　三界有為法，　　一切皆如是。
translation: They're like an illusory plantain or the moon in water, and all the three realms of created things are thus.

source_sentence: 諸法我自覺，　　道成如先佛，　我今大眾會，　　天人作證明。
translation: I myself realize all dharmas, and the path is accomplished like the Buddha before me.

source_sentence: 正法付天神，　　護持眾苦盡，　成於三界尊，　　能令法熾盛。
translation: I've entrusted the gods with the right teaching, protected them from all suffering, made them honored in the three realms, and caused the teaching to flourish.

source_sentence: 顯現八正路，　　邪意惡覺滅，　沙門剎利王，　　激動相瞋惱。
translation: He reveals the eightfold correct path, which ceases wrong thoughts and bad feelings, and agitates the ascetics, the bhadra kings, and the anger that arouses them.

source_sentence: 我今當不久，　　涅槃滅無餘，　大智諸聲聞，　　亦隨我涅槃。
translation: Soon, I'll cease to exist without remainder, and the śrāvakas of great wisdom will follow me into nirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 餘方諸佛國，　　一切諸菩薩，　具大神通者，　　復還向他方。
translation: In other buddha lands, all the bodhisattvas with great supernormal powers will again go back to other lands.

source_sentence: 福德諸國王，　　大臣長者滅，　限滿百年後，　　佛法漸隱沒。
translation: After a hundred years have passed since the deaths of the ministers and elders of those blessed lands, the Buddha's teaching gradually disappears.

source_sentence: 薄福眾生等，　　於我法出家，　不樂於三乘，　　亦不畏後世，　活命故出家，　　多詐無羞恥，　貪求諸名利，　　處處諂嫉妬，　遠離於禪誦，　　復捨諸善法，　晝則樂言訟，　　夜則多睡眠，　樂讀外雜典，　　捨離佛所說，　復與女人通，　　嚴飾身衣服，　為求名利故，　　但營世俗業，　常為他作使，　　通致諸信命，　往返俗人家，　　販賣以自活，　樂作諸田業。
translation: Weakly endowed sentient beings who leave home because of our teaching, don't delight in the three vehicles, aren't afraid of the afterlife, leave home because they want to live, are fraudulent and shameless, crave fame and profit, engage in flattery and jealousy, distance themselves from meditation, abandon good qualities, enjoy discourse by day and sleep by night, read non-Buddhist scriptures, abandon what the Buddha teaches, associate with women, adorn their bodies and clothing, pursue worldly activities for fame and profit, often work as a messenger for others, obtain faithful livelihoods, go back to secular homes, sell for their own living, and enjoy working in the fields.

source_sentence: 又復喜鬪諍。
translation: He's also fond of fighting.

source_sentence: 見諸善比丘，　　梵行多聞者，　嫉妬復瞋罵，　　不容彼坐臥，　而作麁穬語，　　誹謗及毀呰，　於諸俗人邊，　　稱揚不善業，　言此詐比丘，　　是賊最惡人，　若有供養者，　　多得惡名聞。
translation: When he sees a good monk or someone well-versed in the religious life, he becomes jealous and angry, doesn't allow him to sit or lay down, makes crude remarks, denigrates and slanders him, and praises unwholesome actions around secular people, saying, "This fraudulent monk is the worst of thieves, and if he makes offerings, he'll often get a bad reputation.

source_sentence: 於彼不獲福，　　亦莫信彼說。
translation: They don't obtain good fortune from them, and don't believe their words.

source_sentence: 諸寺惡比丘，　　盜說梵行者，　種種不善事，　　是以剎利瞋。
translation: Those evil monks at the temples who steal the teachings of the religious practice do various unwholesome things, which is why Zāri is angry.

source_sentence: 彼諸惡比丘，　　雜以外文頌，　稱讚彼剎利，　　能令剎利喜，　毘舍婆羅門，　　利喜亦如是。
translation: Those evil monks praise him with a variety of foreign-language hymns that please him, and so do the Vaiśravaṇa school's profits and rejoices.

source_sentence: 以是得供養，　　持戒被欺[夌*欠]。
translation: Thus, they obtain offerings and are deceived [dawdled*undefiled] in observing the precepts.

source_sentence: 剎利婆羅門，　　嫌恨持戒者，　嫌恨持戒故，　　致使諸天瞋，　棄捨彼國土，　　剎利輔相臣，　向於寶國土，　　在彼而安住。
translation: Because they resent adherents of the precepts, the gods become angry and abandon their lands, while the auxiliary ministers of the bhadra go to their precious land and stay there.

source_sentence: 輕賤持戒故，　　菩薩亦捨離。
translation: Because they despise observing the precepts, the bodhisattva also abandons them.

source_sentence: 諸天捨離後，　　其國大可畏，　惡龍惡夜叉，　　羅剎鳩槃荼，　入國奪精氣，　　及食其肉血。
translation: After the gods abandon it, that country is so fearsome that bad dragons, bad yakṣas, and Rāṣṭrapāṇḍas enter it to snatch its energy and eat its flesh and blood.

source_sentence: 惡王婆羅門，　　毘舍首陀等，　共護國城邑，　　及以諸村落，　宮舍國園林，　　惡鬼遍充滿，　常奪彼精氣，　　觸惱諸剎利，　婆羅毘舍陀，　　男女等皆瞋。
translation: The evil king Brāhmaṇa, Vaiśravaṇa, and the others guard the country's cities, villages, palaces, country parks, and forests, and are filled with evil spirits that always snatch their vitality and disturb the bhadras, Pārāvaiśuddhas, and men and women alike who are angry.

source_sentence: 復令心變惡，　　互共相鬪諍，　彼等鬪諍故，　　布薩行檀絕。
translation: They also cause their minds to become evil and fight with each other, and as a result of their fights, they cut off the practice of giving alms to the pusa.

source_sentence: 其國水枯涸，　　非時風雨起，　飢饉極儉短，　　乏少資生具，　果苗不成熟，　　地味眾生味，　法味及精氣，　　一切皆損減，　興動諸兵仗，　　互共相劫奪。
translation: Their waters dry up, unseasonable winds and rains arise, they suffer from famine and extreme poverty, lack necessities, their fruits don't ripen, and the taste of the earth, the taste of living beings, and the taste and vitality of the Dharma all decrease, so they mobilize armies and weapons to plunder each other.

source_sentence: 如是慳貪國，　　惡比丘往返，　復以佛僧物，　　飲食諸果藥，　持用與俗人，　　因此得供養。
translation: In such a stingy and greedy country, a bad monk goes back and forth, taking the things of the Buddha and saṃgha, food and drink, and fruit and medicine, giving them to commoners for their use and thus obtaining offerings.

source_sentence: 奴婢及田宅，　　與彼令攝受，　不善比丘等，　　以之為尊長。
translation: He gives them slaves and mansions to take in, and unskillful monks and others take them as their elders.

source_sentence: 少智詐多聞，　　不喜禪戒者，　禪戒者去後，　　為財共鬪諍。
translation: A man of little intelligence and much learning dislikes those who observe the precepts, and after they leave, they fight over their possessions.

source_sentence: 剎利聞生瞋，　　打害惡比丘，　還俗捨法服，　　繫閉於牢獄。
translation: Hearing about it, Zāri becomes angry, strikes and harms a bad monk, returns to the secular world, puts away his religious robes, and is confined to prison.

source_sentence: 以是諸天瞋，　　迭共相告語，　如是國土中，　　旃陀羅王治。
translation: Because of this anger, the gods repeatedly told each other that in this land, King Cāṇḍāla ruled.

source_sentence: 朋黨惡比丘，　　毀破袈裟服，　自壞己國土，　　不久當敗亡。
translation: A bad monk who is a partisan disparages his robe and destroys his own land, and he will soon perish.

source_sentence: 墮在阿鼻獄，　　受苦極長遠，　於是賢劫中，　　無脫地獄時。
translation: They'll fall into the avīci hell and suffer terribly for a long time, and during these good eons there'll be no escape from hell.

source_sentence: 是旃陀羅王，　　眾聖所厭賤，　聽讀檀尸法，　　諂曲虛詐現。
translation: This is King Candra, whom the sages dislike and despise, who listens to the reading of the Dānṣi teachings and shows flattery and deceit.

source_sentence: 是王多詐偽，　　速滅己國土，　苗稼不成熟，　　亢旱及水潦，　鼨鼠惡象暴，　　自他國兵起，　曜入非常宿，　　大地普震動，　白虹妖星墮。
translation: That king is so deceptive that he quickly destroys his own land, the crops don't ripen, there's drought and flooding, wild rats and vicious elephants rage, armies arise from other lands, celestial beams enter the non-perishing constellations, the earth shakes universally, and white rainbows and demonic stars fall.

source_sentence: 時氣多疫病，　焚燒諸聚落，　　速壞國城邑。
translation: The air is plagued by epidemics, burning villages and quickly destroying cities and towns.

source_sentence: 剃頭著袈裟，　　諸佛所加護，　一人出家者，　　天人所供養。
translation: Shaving their heads and putting on the reddish-brown robes, the buddhas protect them, and a person who leaves home is offered support by gods and humans.

source_sentence: 唯除諸如來，　　無有自在者。
translation: Except for the tathāgatas, there's no one who has mastery over them.

source_sentence: 彼旃陀羅王，　　讁罰惡比丘，　毀壞三世佛，　　二種淨法身，　煩惱瘡深重，　　難得值諸佛。
translation: That king Candra punishes bad monks, destroys the buddhas of the three times, purifies the Dharma body in two ways, and causes deep sores of affliction, making it difficult to meet the buddhas.

source_sentence: 諸天皆捨離，　　彼旃陀羅王，　如是國土壞，　　法眼當散滅。
translation: The gods all part with it, and that king Candra, thus his land is destroyed, and the Dharma eye will dissipate.

source_sentence: 諸天捨離故，　　如是國土壞，　三種精氣減，　　毀滅天宮殿，　白法善朋少，　　黑法惡黨增，　於彼濁惡世，　　無有明智人。
translation: Because the gods have abandoned them, thus their land is destroyed, the three kinds of energy are diminished, the palace of the gods is destroyed, the white dharma has few good friends, the black dharma has more bad gang members, and there are no wise people in that turbid and evil world.

source_sentence: 所住阿蘭若，　　樂法安隱住，　彼持我正法，　　能令多眾信。
translation: They abide in a forest, enjoy the peaceful abiding of the Dharma, and they maintain my right teaching, which causes many people to believe in it.

source_sentence: 鬼神敬信故，　　遮障諸怖畏，　增長三精氣，　　熾然我正法，　彼以禪定樂，　　充滿天宮殿。
translation: Because ghosts and spirits revere and believe in them, they shield them from fear, increase the three vital energies, and blaze my right teaching, which fills the palace of heaven with the joy of meditation.

source_sentence: 是故以我法，　　付諸鬼神王，　遮障惡剎利，　　莫惱我聲聞。
translation: Therefore, I deliver my teaching to the king of ghosts and spirits, shield them from harmful karmic benefits, and don't trouble my śrāvakas.

source_sentence: 國王於持戒，　　親近常供養，　破戒不親供，　　捨離各隨住，　國王不惱彼，　　持戒及毀禁。
translation: When a king observes precepts, he always makes offerings close to them, doesn't make offerings close to those who violate them, and abandons those who abandon them, so the king doesn't trouble them, observing precepts and violating prohibitions.

source_sentence: 剎利淨持戒，　　彼此皆信敬，　毘舍婆羅門，　　不惱諸天神，　正法得久住，　　白法常增長。
translation: The bhadra's pure observance of precepts, mutual faith and respect, and the approach of Vaiśravaṇa don't trouble the gods, so the right teaching can be long-lasting and the white dharma can always grow.

source_sentence: 汝等於此土，　　隨意而安住。
translation: Here in this land, you will abide in peace as you like.

source_sentence: 汝等若發心，　　此土常安住，　乃至我法盡，　　莫向諸餘國，　以檀尸羅法，　　令多眾歸信。
translation: If you set your minds to it, this land will always be stable ... until our teaching is ended ... so that you don't go to other countries and cause many people to believe in it because of the Dharma of Dāsīra.

source_sentence: 智者能成熟，　　彼非是希有，　於彼惡世時，　　熾然我正法，　遮障惡剎利，　　此事為希有。
translation: That's rare, for a wise person to mature, not to blaze my right teaching when there's a bad world, and to obscure the harmful karmic benefits is rare.

source_sentence: 慈心常相應，　　莫打我聲聞，　彼二說正法，　　能救地獄苦。
translation: Always associated with kindness, don't strike me as a śrāvaka; these two teach the right Dharma, which can save people from the suffering of hell.

source_sentence: 比丘不護戒，　　國王莫讁罰，　汝諸剎利王，　　莫共沙門鬪。
translation: If a monk doesn't protect the precepts, the king mustn't punish him, and you, the king of the bhadra, mustn't fight with the ascetics.

source_sentence: 俗人作諸惡，　　速趣於地獄，　軟語向彼二，　　遮除諸惡業。
translation: Ordinary people who do evil will quickly end up in hell, so speak softly to those two to stop bad actions.

source_sentence: 莫以麁穬語，　　亦莫打治罰，　以是國不壞，　　增長三精氣，　正法得久住，　　佛法久熾然。
translation: Don't use crude words or punishments, for this will keep your country from decaying, increase the three vital energies, make the right Dharma last, and keep the Buddha's teaching blazing.

source_sentence: 多有說法者，　　能閉三惡趣，　休息世間惡，　　增益諸天眾，　涅槃門得開，　　無漏者則入，　菩薩得增長，　　猶如明分月。
translation: Many speakers of the Dharma can shut out the three bad destinies, rest worldly evil, increase the host of gods, open the gate of nirvāṇa, allow the uncontaminated to enter, and increase bodhisattvas, just like the bright part of the moon.

source_sentence: 能以於六度，　　充滿諸佛法，　是故諸智者，　　所來諸菩薩，　當住於此土，　　熾然我正法，　盲冥失道者，　　當與正法眼。
translation: Because they can fill the buddha-dharma with the six perfections, wise ones and the bodhisattvas who come will abide in this land, blazing with our right teaching, and those who are blind and have lost the way will be given the eye of the right teaching.

source_sentence: 眾生以六度，　　成熟於菩提，　汝等則成供，　　三世諸如來，　速證菩提果，　　淨國作導師。」
translation: With the six perfections, sentient beings ripen into bodhi, and you will become offerings to the tathāgatas of the three times, quickly realize the fruit of bodhi, and serve as mentors in pure countries."

source_sentence: 大眾皆默然，　　唯有賢劫眾，　彌勒為上首，　　一切皆悉起。
translation: The crowd was silent, except for the Bhadrayānīya crowd, headed by Maitreya, who all rose up.

source_sentence: 合掌而白佛，　　咸作如是言：「我不詣餘方，　　護持佛正法，　盡我精進力，　　成熟大菩提，　隨於彼時中，　　應機而說法。
translation: They all put their palms together and said to the Buddha, "I won't go to another place to uphold the Buddha's true teaching, make use of my energy to ripen great enlightenment, and teach according to the opportunity at that time.

source_sentence: 欲有留難時，　　我等不能遮，　法欲滅盡時，　　我亦不能遮。」
translation: When there's a desire to remain in trouble, we can't stop it, and when the teaching is about to end, I can't stop it either."

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊告彼白智童真菩薩摩訶薩，而說偈言：「觀此諸菩薩，　　勇猛執智炬，　無量阿僧祇，　　他方佛土來，　種種善根寶，　　歸依諸佛海，　慈悲方便力，　　於佛法不動。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed that boy bodhisattva Mahāsattva of White Wisdom and spoke in verse, "Look at these bodhisattvas, courageous in holding the torch of wisdom, numberless and incalculable, from buddha lands in other directions, endowed with the treasures of various good roots, taking refuge in the ocean of buddhas, and having the power of compassionate skillful means, they don't budge from the Buddha's teaching.

source_sentence: 於此無有一，　　能持我法者，　賢劫諸菩薩，　　堪能持我法。
translation: There's no one here who can maintain my teaching, not even the bodhisattvas of the good eons, who can maintain my teaching.

source_sentence: 於我滅度後，　　佛法欲滅時，　所有出家者，　　而無有慚恥，　遠離功德智，　　懈怠不精進，　捨道學世業，　　不樂持禁戒。
translation: After I die and when the Buddha's teaching is about to end, all renunciant monks lack conscience, distance themselves from knowledge of merit, become lazy and unproductive, abandon the path and train in worldly activities, and don't enjoy upholding the precepts.

source_sentence: 愚癡與俗交，　　多言復無羞，　貪取佛僧物，　　染著五欲樂，　如是比丘等，　　資生與俗同，　疑惑多貪財，　　邪婬怒嫉妬。
translation: Foolishly, they have intercourse with the common people, talk much and are not ashamed, covet the things of buddhas and monks, and are addicted to the five desires and pleasures. Thus, monks and others are born in the same way as the common people, are doubtful, covet wealth, and are unrighteous, angry, and jealous.

source_sentence: 見住蘭若者，　　說其諸過惡，　不樂讀誦經，　　嗜睡多喜鬪，　如是等沙門，　　厭賤禪蘭若，　堅著於惡事，　　自高輕蔑他。
translation: Seeing someone who lives in a forest, they describe their faults, dislike reading and reciting sūtras, are drowsy and fond of fighting, and are such ascetics who dislike the lowly meditation forest, cling to bad things, and elevate themselves above others.

source_sentence: 沙門及俗人，　　慳貪不捨施，　噉食佛僧物，　　多遭種種病，　無有慈愍心，　　少力惡喜鬪。
translation: Ascetics and laypeople are stingy and greedy, don't abandon charity, devour the goods of buddhas and monks, suffer various illnesses, lack compassion, and have little strength and are fiercely disposed to fighting.

source_sentence: 以是天不雨，　　潤澤悉枯涸，　飢饉遍世間，　　果實無滋味，　乏少於飲食，　　瞋諍相侵奪。
translation: As a result, the heavens don't rain, the moistens all dry up, famine spreads throughout the world, the fruits lack taste, food and drink are scarce, and anger assaults them.

source_sentence: 造十不善業，　　少福無供養，　法味不純厚，　　行法心亦薄，　迭共作麁想，　　殺害無慈愍，　不孝於父母，　　亦不供尊長。
translation: They create ten unwholesome activities, offer little merit, lack the pure taste of the Dharma, and practice a weak mind. They repeatedly share crude concepts, kill and injure without compassion, aren't dutiful to their parents, and don't make offerings to their elders.

source_sentence: 多修世俗行，　　疑惑復嫉妬，　貪染於邪法，　　非法無厭足，　貪求無厭故，　　是以久流轉。
translation: They often cultivate worldly practices, are doubtful and jealous, are addicted to wrong things, have no limit to what's unlawful, and have no limit to their cravings, which is why they've been in a state of perpetual flux.

source_sentence: 如是諸國王，　　及以輔相臣，　沙門婆羅門，　　毘舍首陀羅，　樂鬪憎持戒，　　互共相謗毀。
translation: Thus, the kings of these countries and their ministers, ascetics, priests, and piśāstra are fierce and abhor the observance of precepts, and they all denigrate each other.

source_sentence: 南方邊夷國，　　王名波羅帝，　百千諸軍眾，　　士將共圍繞。
translation: In the southern land of Peipei, there's a king named Pārādi surrounded by a hundred thousand generals.

source_sentence: 西方邊夷國，　　有王名百祀，　亦將百千軍，　　前後共圍繞。
translation: In the western Barbarians, there's a king named Baisai who also has a hundred thousand troops surrounding him from front to back.

source_sentence: 北方邊夷王，　　名善意釋迦，　士將諸營從，　　圍繞亦百千。
translation: To the north, there's a king of Peñcika named Śākyamuni, whose soldiers and followers are surrounded by a hundred thousand.

source_sentence: 東方睒彌國，　　王名為大軍，　眷屬百千眾，　　圍繞而侍衛。
translation: In the eastern land of Śāmbī, there's a king named Ōsun who has a retinue of a hundred thousand men surrounding him and guarding him.

source_sentence: 大軍王有子，　　名之為難看，　生時身著鎧，　　把刀血塗身，　大力身堅固，　　而從母胎生。
translation: When he was born, the king of that army had a son named Nadī, who was armed, had a sword smeared with blood, and had great strength and sturdiness, and he was born from his mother's womb.

source_sentence: 是時長者等，　　大臣五百人，　同時俱生子，　　身亦著鎧甲，　執刀血塗身，　　皆從母胎生。
translation: Then, a great man and 500 ministers were born at the same time, and their bodies were armored and coated with the blood of a sword, and they were all born from their mother's womb.

source_sentence: 是日於其國，　　天龍降血雨，　五百長者子，　　難看同處養。
translation: On that day in that country, a dragon rained down blood, and five hundred sons of elders were raised together in a place that was difficult to see.

source_sentence: 難看年七歲，　　父王授其位，　邊夷三惡王，　　又至北天竺，　破國殺害人，　　怨讐妬女色，　積財以火燒，　　瞋怒向中國。
translation: When Nangao was seven years old, his father gave him the throne, and the three evil kings of the Peipei came to northern India, destroying their country and killing people, hating and loving women, amassing wealth and burning it with fire, and directing their anger at China.

source_sentence: 邊夷王等來，　　毀破佛塔寺，　殺害諸眾僧，　　劫奪佛僧物。
translation: The Banjibi kings and others came, destroyed stūpas and temples, killed the monks, and plundered the property of the buddhas and saṃgha.

source_sentence: 病瘦諸比丘，　　不能走逃避，　少壯強力者，　　散走於諸方，　諸餘比丘等，　　少年初出家，　未善學戒者，　　威儀法不具。
translation: The sick and thin monks who couldn't walk and run away, the young and strong, scattered in different directions, and the rest of the monks who were newly reborn, hadn't yet well trained in the precepts, and didn't have the proper manners.

source_sentence: 處處走逃避，　　隨至被欺[夌*欠]，　毀辱而打罵，　　恒受諸苦惱。
translation: They run and flee from place to place, are deceived [dawdle*awn] at every turn, are insulted and scolded, and are constantly subjected to suffering and distress.

source_sentence: 彼三邊夷王，　　及與諸軍眾，　漸詣拘睒彌，　　十二年中鬪。
translation: Those three barbarian kings and their armies gradually visited Kauśāmbī and fought for twelve years.

source_sentence: 三王及眷屬，　　難看王殺盡，　統領閻浮提，　　而作一蓋王，　於後大悔恨，　　我獲無量罪，　頗有明比丘，　　當與我懺悔。
translation: He killed all three kings and their retinues, looked down on the king, ruled Yambudvīpa, and became the king of one lid. He then greatly regretted that I had committed measureless sins, but there was a learned monk who would repent with me.

source_sentence: 說言有三藏，　　父名為火施，　種姓常清淨，　　是大婆羅門，　子名失師迦，　　高才智勇博，　釋子中大名，　　今住波梨國。
translation: He said there were three collections whose father's name was Firebrand, whose lineage was always pure, who was a great brāhmaṇa, and whose son's name was Lakṣmī, who was highly talented, wise, and courageous, and who was a great name among the sons of the Buddha, and who now lived in the country of Bāli.

source_sentence: 時王即遣使，　　請彼三藏來，　為王演正法，　　令王生敬信。
translation: The king then sent an envoy to invite the Tripiṭaka to come and explain the right teaching to the king, causing him to become respectful and faithful.

source_sentence: 我於十二年，　　戰鬪大作罪，　三王及眷屬，　　軍眾我殺盡。
translation: For twelve years, I fought and committed great crimes, and I killed all three kings and their retinues.

source_sentence: 我亦十二年，　　具設般遮會，　普告閻浮提，　　釋子皆來集。
translation: For twelve years, I also prepared a great assembly, universally addressed Yambudvīpa, and gathered all the sons of the Buddha.

source_sentence: 所有諸比丘，　　住在閻浮提，　願各悉來此，　　受我等供養。
translation: All the monks who live in Jambudvīpa, may they all come here and accept our offerings.

source_sentence: 比丘等悉集，　　睒彌般遮會，　在路有餓死，　　或病在道傍，　中有遭水毒，　　或值賊虎傷，　或復墜山澗，　　比丘死無數。
translation: When monks and others gathered for the Śākyamuni assembly, there were cases of starvation on the road, illness near the road, poison from water in the midst, injury from thieves and tigers, or falling down a mountain stream, and countless monks died.

source_sentence: 餘殘到睒彌，　　威儀法則壞，　百千皆來集，　　設大般遮會。
translation: When the rest of the monks reach Śākyamuni, their manner and rules of conduct are destroyed, and a hundred thousand come together to set up a great banquet of rituals.

source_sentence: 初起般遮日，　　大雲皆悉起，　普遍閻浮提，　　降澍於大雨，　時王甚歡喜，　　此是眾僧力，　比丘既集已，　　互共相借問，　頗見我和上，　　及問阿闍梨，　知識諸等侶，　　同學何處去？
translation: On the first rising day of the assembly, great clouds arose over Jambudvīpa, sending down torrents of rain. The king was overjoyed that this was the power of the saṃgha.

source_sentence: 我今得來此，　　彼或道路亡，　高聲大悲哭，　　相戀而嘷啼。
translation: "Now that I've come here, perhaps they've died on the road, raised their voices in great lamentation, and lamented in love.

source_sentence: 失師三藏起，　　少時靜默住，　比丘大嘷哭，　　惆悵不自抑。
translation: When the monk who had lost his teacher, the Tripiṭaka, rose and stayed in silence for a while, the monk wailed loudly, unable to stop himself from feeling sad.

source_sentence: 王見彼嘷哭，　　曉諭亦不止。
translation: Seeing his lamentation, the king also stopped his reprimand.

source_sentence: 時王自思惟，　　此有羅漢不？
translation: The king then thought to himself, "Is there a arhat here?

source_sentence: 天神夜告王，　　還於波梨弗，　善財長者子，　　名曰涑羅多，　是大阿羅漢，　　恒在香山中，　三明解脫具，　　而來安住此，　今於此大月，　　十五日布薩，　由此布薩故，　　百千眾集會。
translation: The gods told the king by night that he had returned to Piliputra, "The eldest son of Sun Cai, named Blossom, a great arhat who's always up on Mount Gandhāra and fully equipped with the three kinds of liberation, has come to stay here and now preaches on the fifteenth day of this great month, and as a result of that preaching, a hundred thousand people gather here.

source_sentence: 中有一三藏，　　復有阿羅漢，　于時諸天眾，　　皆來聽布薩。
translation: There's a tripiṭaka and arhat in there, and at the time, all the gods came to hear the preaching.

source_sentence: 今是最後集，　　當作無上護，　法幢當摧折，　　法炬當散滅，　法山欲崩頹，　　法海當枯涸，　八種功德水，　　最後當亦竭。
translation: Now, at this final assembly, the Dharma banner will be broken down, the Dharma torch will be scattered, the Dharma mountain will crumble, the Dharma ocean will dry up, and the eight kinds of meritorious waters will eventually dry up.

source_sentence: 比丘眾聲亂，　　三藏于時起，　高聲言寂靜，　　諦聽戒律儀。
translation: When the multitude of monks' voices is disturbed, the Tripiṭaka rises, speaks quietly in a loud voice, and pays close attention to the precepts and regulations.

source_sentence: 所有諸釋子，　　一切皆來集，　我於此眾中，　　多聞到彼岸，　學戒猶不淨，　　何況於餘人！
translation: All the sons of the Śākyas have come together, and here I am among the many who have heard so much that I've reached the other shore, and even though my training in precepts is impure, how could it be possible for others to follow it?

source_sentence: 若有一比丘，　　能持此禁戒，　威儀無缺者，　　今當為布薩。
translation: "If there's a monk who can uphold these precepts and whose deportment is not flawed, he will now become a poṣadha.

source_sentence: 若於毘尼戒，　　威儀無缺犯，　於此大眾前，　　有者今當現，　為學戒律者，　　今當作布薩。
translation: If there's one who observes the vinaya precepts with unimpeded decorum and is present before this assembly, he'll now become a poṣadha for those who have trained in the precepts and regulations.

source_sentence: 羅漢涑羅多，　　即起師子吼，　依如經中說，　　我學戒清淨，　決定無有疑，　　布薩我當聽，　如佛之所說，　　禁戒我善學。
translation: Arhat Blessed Blossom then aroused the lion's roar, relying on what the sūtras say, 'My training in the precepts is pure, I'm certain without doubt,' and I will listen to the poosas, for I have well trained in the prohibitions and precepts as the Buddha has taught.

source_sentence: 三藏有弟子，　　名曰鴦伽多，　懆惡即瞋罵，　　咄彼涑羅多，　經中未見汝，　　是學戒律者。
translation: The Tripiṭaka has a disciple named Aṅgata who becomes angry and insults him when he's displeased, "Duh, Blossom, I haven't seen you in the sūtras as someone who trains in the precepts.

source_sentence: 大德如是說，　　云何故違反？
translation: Venerable thus speaking, why did he violate them?

source_sentence: 鴦伽瞋極盛，　　兩手執大棒，　打殺阿羅漢，　　淨戒可敬者。
translation: With his anger so intense that he wields a large stick with both hands, Aṅga kills an arhat or someone venerable who upholds the precepts.

source_sentence: 諸善比丘等，　　大哭而嘷啼，　各各相瞋怒，　　毀破身衣服。
translation: The good monks and others cried out and wailed, each became angry, and dismembered their robes.

source_sentence: 時有大夜叉，　　名目佉檀提，　於佛深生信，　　敬重佛正法，　即以金剛杵，　　殺害彼鴦伽，　由殺阿羅漢，　　無著涑羅多。
translation: Then, a great yakṣa named Mokṣadantī, who had deep faith in the Buddha and respected his true teaching, used a vajra and pounder to kill that arhat and injure him, thus killing him and making him an unattached blossom.

source_sentence: 復有惡比丘，　　名曰鷄多羅，　兩手亦執棒，　　復殺彼三藏。
translation: Then there was another bad monk named Ākyatāra, who also held a staff in both hands and killed that tripiṭaka.

source_sentence: 比丘皆悉起，　　各各共相殺，　百千諸比丘，　　存活者無幾。
translation: The monks all rose up and killed each other, and not many of the hundreds of thousands of monks survived.

source_sentence: 是時須臾頃，　　大地普震動，　於其虛空中，　　出大惡音聲，　四方起大惡，　　火爨數百千，　火幢大可畏，　　現住在空中。
translation: In a moment's time, the earth shook universally, and in the sky there arose a great evil sound, great evil in all directions, hundreds of thousands of fire torches, and a great and fearful fire banner that now stands in the sky.

source_sentence: 彗星及妖星，　　四方而流墮，　千億諸天神，　　皆作如是言：　釋迦所集法，　　今日當隱沒。
translation: Comets and demonic stars fall in every direction, and a hundred billion gods say, "Today, the teaching that Śākyamuni has gathered will be hidden!

source_sentence: 色界諸天子，　　一切欲界天，　正法隱沒已，　　大聲悲嘷哭。
translation: The gods of the form realm and all the gods of the desire realm wail with great lamentation after the true teaching is concealed.

source_sentence: 見佛諸夜叉，　　墮地而宛轉，　從今於世間，　　更無有佛法，　律儀木叉戒，　　一切悉空無，　闇冥遍世間，　　無救無歸趣。
translation: Seeing the buddhas and yakṣas fall to the ground and wander about, there's no more buddha dharma in the world today, no more restraints, no more mokṣa precepts, nothing at all, darkness pervading the world, and no salvation or refuge.

source_sentence: 諸人等不久，　　無異於麞鹿，　法幢當摧折，　　法鼓聲亦絕，　甘露門閉塞，　　法師亦喪亡，　法炬當散滅，　　法輪更不轉。
translation: Soon, all of us will be no different than a speckled deer, the Dharma banner will be broken down, the Dharma drum's sound will cease, the ambrosial gate will be shut, the Dharma teacher will perish, the Dharma torch will dissipate, and the Dharma wheel will no longer turn.

source_sentence: 正法橋破壞，　　法足不復行，　法水止不流，　　法河永枯涸，　法山欲崩頹，　　法海當復竭。
translation: The bridge of the true Dharma is destroyed, the Dharma leg no longer travels, the Dharma water stops flowing, the Dharma river dries up forever, the Dharma mountain is about to crumble, and the Dharma ocean will again dry up.

source_sentence: 住林阿蘭若，　　所有諸天子，　于時大怖畏，　　悲嘷而自撲。
translation: Those gods and goddesses who live in the forest araṇya are terrified, and they lament and pounce on themselves.

source_sentence: 有諸魔眷屬，　　邪見諸惡黨，　歌舞皆歡喜，　　踊躍弄衣服，　釋迦所說法，　　趣彼甘露者，　隱沒是其宜，　　我法得熾盛。
translation: Māra's retinue and the evil gang of those who hold wrong views rejoice in song and dance, dance and get dressed, and the teachings of the Śākyas lead them to the nectar of the Dharma, which is suitable for concealing them and making our teaching flourish.

source_sentence: 難看王既知，　　正法隱沒已，　從初至後夜，　　出城往詣彼，　見諸比丘屍，　　墮地即悶絕，　良久乃得穌，　　而復更悲啼。
translation: After realizing that the right teaching had been concealed, the king left the city from the beginning to the end of the night and went there to see the corpses of the monks who had fallen to the ground and were immediately overcome, but after a long time they were brought back to life and then lamented.

source_sentence: 見殺阿羅漢，　　三藏失師迦，　無量比丘死，　　我亦不久活。
translation: Seeing the killing of arhats, the loss of the tripiṭaka's teacher, and the death of countless monks, I won't be alive for long.

source_sentence: 收拾阿羅漢，　　別取三藏屍，　及諸比丘喪，　　種種而闍維。
translation: I gathered up the arhat, separately took the body of the Tripiṭaka, and the monks who had perished, planting seeds and making jhāpita.

source_sentence: 餘殘在比丘，　　召喚集一處，　餚饌眾美味，　　種種而供養。
translation: The rest of the remaining monks were summoned to one place, where they were fed a variety of delicious foods and offered up various treats.

source_sentence: 復捨千萬寶，　　一寶直百千，　以此眾寶物，　　擬造五百寺。
translation: He also gave up a thousand million treasures, one of which amounted to a hundred thousand, and with these many treasures, he planned to build 500 temples.

source_sentence: 一一諸比丘，　　各施百千物，　師等在此住，　　我等當養育，　為我說正法，　　我當至心聽。
translation: Each monk gives a hundred thousand things, and we'll nurture the teachers who live here and explain the right teaching to me, so I'll listen with all my heart.

source_sentence: 一切皆默然，　　無有說法者。
translation: All were silent, and there was no Dharma preacher.

source_sentence: 其王三勸請，　　白諸比丘已，　亦皆默然住，　　一切無說者。
translation: After the king had repeatedly urged them and told the monks, they all remained silent, and there was no one who explained the teaching.

source_sentence: 王白諸比丘：　　可不知法耶？
translation: The king said to the monks, "Don't you know the teaching?

source_sentence: 語已袈裟白，　　染色不復現，　從床皆墮落，　　宛轉在於地。
translation: After he spoke, his robe turned white, its coloring didn't reappear, and he fell off his bed and landed on the ground in a heap.

source_sentence: 咸皆稱佛言，　　佛法寶隱沒，　鬚髮爪皆長，　　諸法亦忘失。
translation: Everyone called out to the Buddha, saying, "The Buddha's Dharma treasure is concealed, his beard, hair, and nails are all long, and he has forgotten all the teachings.

source_sentence: 當時虛空中，　　大聲震於地，　一切皆遍動，　　猶如水上輪。
translation: At that moment, a great noise in the sky shook the ground, and everything was moved about like a wheel on water.

source_sentence: 城壁碎落下，　　屋宇悉圯坼，　樹林根枝葉，　　花葉果藥盡。
translation: City walls crumble and fall, buildings are all torn down, trees and forests have roots and branches, and flowers, leaves, fruits, and medicines are all gone.

source_sentence: 唯除淨居天，　　欲界一切處，　七味三精氣，　　損減無有餘。
translation: Only the Pure Land gods and all parts of the desire realm are excluded, and the seven flavors and three essences are diminished without remainder.

source_sentence: 解脫諸善論，　　當時一切盡，　所生花果味，　　希少亦不美，　諸有井泉池，　　一切盡枯涸，　土地悉鹹鹵，　　剖裂成丘澗。
translation: All the good arguments for liberation are then exhausted, producing flowers and fruits that taste rare and unsatisfactory, wells and springs that exist and pools that dry up completely, salting and salting the earth and splitting it into hills and rivers.

source_sentence: 諸山皆焦然，　　天龍不降雨，　苗稼皆枯死，　　甘蔗劫貝藥，　生者皆死盡，　　餘草更不生。
translation: The mountains are scorched, the gods and dragons don't send rain, the crops wither, the sugarcane and seashell medicines die off, and the remaining grass doesn't grow.

source_sentence: 雨土皆昏闇，　　日月不現明，　四方皆亢旱，　　數現諸惡瑞。
translation: The rainy soil is darkened, the sun and moon don't shine, the four directions are overwhelmed by drought, and there are numerous bad portents.

source_sentence: 十不善業道，　　貪瞋癡倍增，　眾生於父母，　　視之如麞鹿。
translation: The ten unwholesome courses of action, greed, and folly multiply, and sentient beings are viewed by their parents as if they were deer.

source_sentence: 眾生及壽命，　　色力威樂減，　遠離人天樂，　　皆悉墮惡道。
translation: Their sentient beings and lifespan are diminished in appearance and power, and they're far removed from the pleasures of humans and gods, and they all fall into a bad destiny.

source_sentence: 如是不善業，　　惡王惡比丘，　毀壞我正法，　　損減天人道。
translation: Such unwholesome actions and evil kings and monks disrupt our right teaching and diminish the human race in the heavens.

source_sentence: 諸天善神王，　　悲愍眾生者，　棄此濁惡國，　　皆悉向餘方。
translation: Good gods and kings of gods who have compassion for sentient beings abandon this impure and evil land and all go to other lands.

source_sentence: 先佛不作者，　　我今為眾生，　棄捨身壽命，　　為增三精氣，　悲愍眾生故，　　捨壽第三分，　令我法海滿，　　洗浴諸天人。
translation: Previously, the Buddha didn't author, but now, for the sake of sentient beings, I've given up my body and life to increase the three vital energies, and out of pity for sentient beings, I've given up the third part of my life so that my ocean of Dharma might be filled and I might bathe the gods and humans.

source_sentence: 過去諸如來，　　依壽而滅度，　彼於七日後，　　正法皆隱沒。
translation: Tathāgatas in the past depended on the life span of the tathāgata before they were extinguished, and after seven days, the true teaching was concealed.

source_sentence: 今我涅槃後，　　正法五百年，　住在於世間，　　眾生煩惱盡，　精進諸菩薩，　　得滿於六度，　行者速能入，　　無漏安隱城。
translation: Now, 500 years after my nirvāṇa, the true teaching remains in the world, ending the afflictions of sentient beings and energetic bodhisattvas who attain the full accomplishment of the six perfections and whose practitioners quickly enter the untainted city of peace.

source_sentence: 像法住於世，　　限滿一千年，　剃頭著袈裟，　　持戒及毀禁，　天人所供養，　　常令無所乏，　如是供養彼，　　則為供養我。
translation: When the true Dharma abides in the world for a limited time of 1,000 years, they shave their heads and put on the reddish-brown robes, observe precepts and violate prohibitions, and are supported by gods and humans, always making nothing lacking; thus supporting them is supporting me.

source_sentence: 若有為我法，　　歸依而剃頭，　身著袈裟衣，　　說彼是我子，　假使破禁戒，　　悉住不退地。
translation: If someone takes refuge in my teachings, shaves their head, puts on the reddish-brown robes, and says they're my son, then even if they break the precepts, they'll all stay in the stage of nonretrogression.

source_sentence: 若有撾打彼，　　則為打我身，　若有罵辱彼，　　則為毀辱我，　是人心欲滅，　　正法大明燈。
translation: If someone hits them with a lion, they are hitting me personally; if someone insults them, they insult me; this is the desire of the human mind that goes out, and it's a great bright lamp of the right teaching.

source_sentence: 故為器非器，　　捨壽第三分，　為眾得安樂，　　饒益諸天人。
translation: So he makes himself a vessel and not a vessel, renounces the third part of his life, attains happiness for all, and benefits gods and humans.

source_sentence: 我昔行苦行，　　為諸眾生故，　捨已自身樂，　　令法久熾然，　我昔捨身命，　　為諸病人故，　亦為貧眾生，　　令法久熾然。
translation: In the past, I practiced austerities for the sake of sentient beings, abandoning myself to my own happiness so that the Dharma would be long-lasting and blazing, and I used to lay down my life for the sake of the sick and for the sake of poor sentient beings so that the Dharma would be long-lasting and blazing.

source_sentence: 我昔為菩提，　　捨財及妻子，　寶象馬車乘，　　令法久熾然。
translation: In the past, I gave up my wealth and wife for the sake of enlightenment, and I rode in a jeweled elephant and horse chariot, so that the Dharma would long remain blazing.

source_sentence: 我昔供諸佛，　　緣覺及聲聞，　父母諸師長，　　令法久熾然。
translation: In the past, I made offerings to the buddhas, pratyekbuddhas, and direct disciples, parents, and teachers, so that the Dharma would long remain blazing.

source_sentence: 為聞菩提故，　　無量阿僧祇，　備受種種苦，　　令法久熾然。
translation: For the sake of hearing about enlightenment, I had to endure countless incalculably long hours of suffering, so that the Dharma would long remain blazing.

source_sentence: 我修戒律儀，　　長夜常勤行，　十方佛為證，　　令法久熾然。
translation: I cultivated precepts and discipline, always diligently practicing them long into the night, and the buddhas of the ten directions were my witnesses, making the Dharma blaze for a long time.

source_sentence: 我昔常忍辱，　　忍諸惡眾生，　為眾除煩惱，　　令法久熾然。
translation: I used to be patient and tolerant of unwholesome sentient beings, ridding them of affliction and making the Dharma blaze for a long time.

source_sentence: 我昔勤精進，　　堅固常伏他，　度脫諸眾生，　　令法久熾然。
translation: I used to make painstaking effort, resolutely subduing others, liberating sentient beings, and making the Dharma blaze for a long time.

source_sentence: 我修禪解脫，　　無色三摩提，　恒沙不可數，　　令法久熾然。
translation: I cultivated liberation through meditation, a formless samādhi that was incalculable and made the Dharma blaze for a long time.

source_sentence: 我昔為般若，　　住在於閑林，　演說無量論，　　令法久熾然。
translation: Once, I lived in a quiet forest for Prajñā, expounding measureless treatises, making the Dharma blaze for a long time.

source_sentence: 我昔常憐愍，　　捨已身血肉，　及捨身支節，　　為增正法眼。
translation: I used to have compassion for sentient beings, giving up my own flesh and blood and abandoning the limbs of my body to increase the eye of the true teaching.

source_sentence: 我愍惡眾生，　　以慈而成熟，　安置於三乘，　　增長正法施。
translation: I pitied unwholesome sentient beings, matured them with kindness, placed them in the three vehicles, and increased my generosity to the right Dharma.

source_sentence: 我昔智方便，　　度脫諸惡見，　安置於正慧，　　法雨令不絕。
translation: With knowledge and skillful means, I freed myself from bad views, placed myself in right wisdom, and made the Dharma rain never end.

source_sentence: 我昔以四攝，　　救度諸眾生，　滅惡煩惱火，　　令四眾久住。
translation: With the four methods of winning sentient beings, I saved them, extinguished the fires of bad afflictions, and made the four groups of people long-lasting.

source_sentence: 我昔除外道，　　諸惡邪見網，　安置於正路，　　四眾得供養。
translation: In the past, I removed the web of bad views from the external path and placed them on the right path, so the four groups of people could make offerings.

source_sentence: 我為彼捨命，　　慈愍度眾生，　不令世間闇，　　而有所歸趣。
translation: I sacrificed my life for them, kindly redeemed sentient beings, and didn't allow the darkness of the world to be a place of refuge.

source_sentence: 如是於後時，　　欲令法不壞，　是故囑法眼，　　饒益諸眾生。
translation: Thus, at a later time, wanting to make sure the Dharma doesn't perish, I will give the Dharma eye to enrich sentient beings.

source_sentence: 於我滅度後，　　菩薩向餘方，　為欲不滅壞，　　一切賢聖法。
translation: After my extinction, the bodhisattvas will go to other lands in order to prevent the decay of all good and noble qualities.

source_sentence: 故我今說呪，　　令法久熾然。
translation: So now I'll say a dhāraṇī that will make the Dharma long and fiery.

source_sentence: 金剛密無缺，　　解脫味所依，　所有十方佛，　　當與我說欲，　在此所來者，　　大眾亦與欲。」
translation: The vajra is dense and faultless, the taste of liberation depends on it, and all the buddhas of the ten directions will explain their desires to me, and those who come here will also share their desires."

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊為令正法得久住故，說大陀羅尼呪：「哆地夜他　阿婆牟寄　婆牟寄　質闍牟寄　佉羅牟寄　遮羅摩兮　阿兮　阿兮　達囉婆帝　摩呵地唎滯　悉耽婆羅兮　闍迦利　磨什婆隷　達囉牟駛　能伽咩什婆隸　什婆囉摩涅婆波　蘇婆呵」爾時，世尊說此金剛堅固深密解脫味體陀羅尼句時，遍此三千大千世界六種震動，天降花雨，一切樂器不鼓自鳴。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān spoke this great dhāraṇī spell in order to make the right teaching last, "Dhṛtiyathā, avāmuṣṭa, vāmuṣṭa, khārāmuṣṭa, cārāma-rāja, oxiṣṭa, darabhadī, mahādirīya, sthavirā, sthavirā, nāgabhāsvara, shivarāja, darāmuṣṭa, svāhāra," and when the Bhagavān spoke this dhāraṇī phrase of the adamantine, profound, and liberating taste, six things in the 3,000 great one-thousand worlds shook, raining flowers from the heavens, and all musical instruments sounded without drumming.

source_sentence: 諸來大眾遍滿大地，皆悉悲泣流淚讚歎，而作是言：「釋迦牟尼如來、應、正遍知甚為奇特，未曾有法大悲具足，隨彼眾生為成熟故，安置顯現未來法故捨第三分壽。」
translation: The whole world was filled with people from all over the world who wept with sorrow and praised, saying, "The Śākyamuni Tathāgata, Arhat, and Perfectly Omniscient is quite extraordinary, endowed with great compassion for unprecedented things, and he follows those sentient beings in order to mature them and set aside the third part of their lives in order to reveal future things."

source_sentence: 說是語時，在會眾生依煩惱身者心得敬信，盡虛空量諸眾生等未發無上菩提心者皆悉發心，九十二那由他眾生得柔順忍，八那由他眾生得首楞嚴三昧聖燈三昧，十萬諸夜叉見四真諦，二千菩薩得共行測量毘尼三昧，六十四百千阿修羅得殊勝行那羅延三昧，八那由他百千諸天得清淨行三昧，三十那由他百千鳩槃茶得勝幢上燈三昧，二十那由他百千諸龍得不欺[夌*欠]力行三昧，二萬比丘盡諸有漏心得解脫。
translation: 說是語時，在會眾生依煩惱身者心得敬信，盡虛空量諸眾生等未發無上菩提心者皆悉發心，九十二那由他眾生得柔順忍，八那由他眾生得首楞嚴三昧聖燈三昧，十萬諸夜叉見四真諦，二千菩薩得共行測量毘尼三昧，六十四百千阿修羅得殊勝行那羅延三昧，八那由他百千諸天得清淨行三昧，三十那由他百千鳩槃茶得勝幢上燈三昧，二十那由他百千諸龍得不欺[夌*欠]力行三昧，二萬比丘盡諸有漏心得解脫。

source_sentence: 爾時，智炬童真菩薩摩訶薩，白文殊師利菩薩摩訶薩言：「了知清淨士！
translation: It was then that Mañjuśrī Mahoṣa, the youthful true bodhisattva of the torch of wisdom, said to Mañjuśrī, the bodhisattva-mahāsattva, "You know, Seishō Jōnai!

source_sentence: 觀此釋迦牟尼如來，以大名稱充滿十方諸佛國土。
translation: "Observe this Śākyamuni Tathāgata as he fills all the Buddha lands in the ten directions with his great name.

source_sentence: 云何充滿？
translation: How is it filled?

source_sentence: 謂釋迦牟尼佛從初發心求阿耨多羅三藐三菩提已來，於一切眾生平等安置，以福田心種種勤修而行布施，於一切菩薩道修最勝行，成熟一切諸眾生故發最勝願，捨清淨國至此五濁眾苦世界，於阿耨多羅三藐三菩提而成正覺。
translation: Since he first set out to pursue the unsurpassed, correct enlightenment, the Śākyamuni Buddha has placed all sentient beings equally, cultivated generosity with the attitude of a field of merit, cultivated the most excellent practices on all bodhisattva paths, made the most excellent vow to ripen all sentient beings, abandoned pure lands to this world of the five turbidities and sufferings, and become perfectly enlightened in the unsurpassed, correct enlightenment.

source_sentence: 以大慈悲因緣力故，為無間業誹謗正法毀呰賢聖一切不善惡業纏縛，十方一切清淨佛土所棄眾生，為諸煩惱之所縛者，成熟如是諸眾生故，於此娑婆世界求阿耨多羅三藐三菩提，於一切菩薩道修最勝行，是人今於五濁世界，於阿耨多羅三藐三菩提而成正覺。
translation: Because of the power of the causes and conditions of great compassion, this person, bound by unremitting activity that denigrates the true teaching and disparages the good and noble, bound by all unskillful and bad actions, abandoning sentient beings in all pure Buddha-lands in the ten directions, and bound by various afflictions, matures such sentient beings and seeks unsurpassed, correct awakening in the five turbid realms while cultivating the most excellent practices for the path of all bodhisattvas.

source_sentence: 此無間業諸眾生等，種種罵辱誹謗如來，輕賤毀呰勤加逼惱。
translation: These unremittingly active sentient beings variously ridicule and denigrate the Tathāgata, despise and disparage him, and diligently oppress him.

source_sentence: 彼等以嫉妬因緣故，種種方便心欲殺害，復以種種兵仗刀箭、[矛*(替-曰+貝)]鉾鉞斧、崩大石山、毒藥水火，復放狂象、師子、虎豹、惡牛、惡狗勤加害佛。
translation: Because of their jealousy, they want to kill with various means, and they also use various weapons, swords, arrows, [spears*(ti-yi+pui)] spears, spears, axes, large rocks, mountains, poisonous water, and fire, and they set loose wild elephants, lions, tigers, leopards, harsh cattle, and harsh dogs to inflict harm on the Buddha.

source_sentence: 爾時，如來猶於彼等諸眾生所，以大慈悲哀憐覆護，踰於父母視其一子，於諸苦海方便拔濟，是以今佛釋迦如來於十方佛土名稱普聞。
translation: At the time, the Tathāgata was still there with those sentient beings, covering them with great compassion and kindness, looking after them more than a father and mother would a son, and skillfully rescuing them from the ocean of suffering, which is why the Buddha Shakyamuni is now universally known in the ten directions of the Buddha-lands.

source_sentence: 今復為此諸眾生故，以一切法付囑天龍諸鬼神等，為令法眼久住熾然。
translation: Now, for the sake of these sentient beings, he also entrusts gods and dragons, ghosts, and so forth with all the teachings, so that the Dharma eye may remain abiding and blazing for a long time.

source_sentence: 復為眾生捨第三分壽，亦為法眼久住熾然，一切聲聞器以非器，及諸剃頭著袈裟者，為護持故，不惱害故，增長三精氣故，以是釋迦如來於此十方一切佛土、一切如來、一切菩薩摩訶薩、一切大智諸天人所，極得名稱充滿十方。
translation: Furthermore, when he renounces the third life span for sentient beings and also for the sake of making the Dharma eye long-lasting and blazing, all the śrāvakas, non-vakas, and those who shave their heads and wear the reddish-brown robes guard them, don't harm them, and increase the three vital energies, so the Buddha Tathāgata attains the name that fills the ten directions with all the Buddha-lands, all the tathāgatas, all the bodhisattvas, mahāsattvas, and all the gods and humans of great wisdom.

source_sentence: 是故一切諸來菩薩摩訶薩等，各各相與隨力所堪，皆設第一最上供具，供養如來尊重恭敬。」
translation: Therefore, all the bodhisattvas, mahāsattvas, and so forth, each in proportion to their abilities, make the highest and most outstanding offerings to the Tathāgata with respect and reverence."

source_sentence: 爾時，一切諸來大眾菩薩摩訶薩等，從座而起口眼微笑。
translation: At that point, all the bodhisattvas, mahāsattvas, and others from the masses rose from their seats, smiled with their mouths and eyes, and said.

source_sentence: 彼諸菩薩於此娑婆世界，遍雨種種寶供養具供養世尊，有雨碎金，有雨碎銀，有雨碎毘琉璃，有雨碎頗梨，有雨赤真珠，有雨碎馬瑙，有雨碎車璩，有雨龍蛇所愛重者碎栴檀香，有雨牛頭栴檀香，有雨多摩羅跋香，有雨黑堅沈水香，有雨種種眾妙寶花，有雨七寶蓋、七寶幢、七寶幡、金縷、真珠、瓔珞、環釧。
translation: In this sahā world, those bodhisattvas were showering offerings of various treasures to the Bhagavān, including crushed gold, crushed silver, crushed vaiḍūrya, crushed pāri, crushed red real pearls, crushed cornelian, crushed charioteer, crushed sandalwood, which is prized by dragons and snakes, crushed oxhead sandalwood, Tamālapatra, black solid water, various flowers of many wonderful treasures, seven-jeweled canopies, seven-jeweled banners, gold thread, genuine pearls, jewelry, and rings.

source_sentence: 有持劫波如意寶樹，有持寶衣樹，有持寶花樹，有持寶器樹，有持寶香樹，供養世尊。
translation: There's a kalpa-ruly jeweled tree, a jeweled robe tree, a jeweled flower tree, a jeweled vessel tree, and a jeweled fragrance tree that they carry to offer to the Bhagavān.

source_sentence: 復有菩薩於娑婆土所有樹林花葉果實一切草木，變成七寶而供養佛。
translation: Another bodhisattva makes offerings to the Buddha from all the trees, forests, flowers, leaves, fruits, and all the vegetation in the land of Sāva, turning it into seven treasures.

source_sentence: 復有菩薩，於娑婆土一切所有山石塼瓦，變成七寶而供養佛。
translation: Once again, there's a bodhisattva who makes offerings to the Buddha by turning all the hills, rocks, tiles, and stonework in the Śrāvastī land into seven treasures.

source_sentence: 復有菩薩，於娑婆土一切所有大地界分，變為微妙諸天寶香而供養佛。
translation: Once again, there's a bodhisattva who makes offerings to the Buddha by turning all the elements of the great ground in the Sāva land into the fragrance of the treasures of the subtle gods.

source_sentence: 一切眾生依地住者，彼等七日七夜身心快樂猶若諸天。
translation: When all sentient beings live on the ground, they're as happy in body and mind as the gods for seven days and nights.

source_sentence: 復有菩薩於娑婆土一切所有大水界分，變為諸天第一微妙甘露美味香潔醇具水界，眾生七日七夜身心快樂猶若諸天。
translation: Once again, there's a bodhisattva who transforms all the elements of the great waters of the Śāvaka land into the most subtle, sweet, delicious, clean, and full-flavored waters of the gods, and sentient beings are as happy in body and mind as those in the gods for seven days and nights.

source_sentence: 復有菩薩，以一切風變為微妙清淨香風而供養佛，於三惡道所有眾生，一切無餘香風觸故，七日七夜身心快樂猶若諸天。
translation: Another bodhisattva makes offerings to the Buddha by transforming all the winds into subtle, pure fragrant breezes, and all the sentient beings in the three evil destinies are as happy in body and mind as the gods for seven days and nights because they are touched by all the fragrant breezes without remainder.

source_sentence: 爾時，上至阿迦膩吒天，下至四天王身天，及諸天女一切無餘，而以種種微妙音聲讚歎世尊，復以種種歌舞音樂而供養佛。
translation: At the time, gods ranging from Akaniṣṭha down to the four heavenly kings and goddesses praised the Bhagavān with all kinds of exquisite sounds, and they also made offerings to the Buddha with all kinds of song and music.

source_sentence: 一切夜叉、一切羅剎、一切鳩槃茶、一切乾闥婆、一切阿修羅、一切緊那羅、餓鬼、毘舍遮、富單那、迦吒富單那、人、非人等，彼等一切隨力所堪作種種讚歎，乃至種種供養世尊。
translation: All the yakṣas, all the rājasas, all the kumbhāṇḍas, all the gandharvas, all the asuras, all the kiṃnaras, all the hungry ghosts, the piśācīs, the pūtanas, the kaṭapūtanas, humans, non-humans, and so forth, praised each other in various ways according to their abilities, and they all made various offerings to the Bhagavān.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊告上首彌勒，及賢劫中一切菩薩摩訶薩言：「諸善男子！
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed the Śubha Maitreya and all the bodhisattvas and mahāsattvas of the good eon, saying, "Good sons!

source_sentence: 我昔行菩薩道時，曾於過去諸佛如來作是供養，以此善根與我作於三菩提因。
translation: When I was practicing the bodhisattva path, I made this kind of offering to the buddha-tathāgatas in the past, and this was the good root that created the three causes of enlightenment for me.

source_sentence: 我今憐愍諸眾生故，以此報果分作三分，留一分自受；第二分者，於我滅後與禪解脫三昧堅固相應聲聞令無所乏；第三分者，與彼破戒、讀誦經典、相應聲聞正法像法、剃頭、著袈裟者令無所乏。
translation: Now, out of pity for sentient beings, I've divided the fruit of this reward into three parts, reserving one part for myself; the second part, after I die out, I'll give it to a śrāvaka associated with the samādhi of liberation through meditation and firmness, so that there's nothing to lose; and the third part, I'll give it to someone who breaks the precepts, recites the scriptures, corresponds with the śrāvaka's correct teaching and the Dharma, shaves their head, and puts on the reddish-brown robes, so that there's nothing to lose.

source_sentence: 「彌勒！
translation: "Maitreya!

source_sentence: 我今復以三業相應諸聲聞眾，比丘、比丘尼、優婆塞、優婆夷，寄付汝手，勿令乏少孤獨而終，及以正法像法毀破禁戒著袈裟者，寄付汝手，勿令彼等於諸資具乏少而終，亦勿令有旃陀羅王共相惱害身心受苦。
translation: "Now, I'll also entrust to you the śrāvakas, monks, nuns, laymen, and laywomen associated with the three activities, so that they don't end up destitute and alone, and those who wear robes that violate the precepts because of their correct teaching and the way it is entrusted to you, so that they don't end up destitute of their necessities and don't allow King Candra to work together to harm their bodies and minds and cause them to suffer.

source_sentence: 我今復以彼諸施主寄付汝手，我今所有器以非器為我出家而供養者，汝等亦當護持養育。
translation: Now, I'll also entrust those donors to your hands, and you must guard and nurture all the vessels and non-vessels I have now that I've left home and made offerings to them.

source_sentence: 「彌勒！
translation: "Maitreya!

source_sentence: 若於現在及未來世，讀誦受持此法門者，彼等當得十種清淨功德。
translation: If someone recites and maintains this teaching in the present and future lives, they will attain ten kinds of pure virtues.

source_sentence: 何等為十？
translation: What are the ten?

source_sentence: 身清淨故，離殺生、離偷盜、離邪行；口清淨故，不妄語、不惡口、不兩舌、不綺語；心清淨故，離貪欲、離瞋恚、離邪見，是為十。
translation: Because the body is purified, it's free of killing, stealing, and wrongdoing; because the mouth is purified, it doesn't speak falsely, doesn't speak harshly, doesn't double-talk, and doesn't speak fancy; and because the mind is purified, it's free of desire, free of anger, and free of wrong views.

source_sentence: 從是已後，百千萬生常得如是十種清淨功德。
translation: From then on, a hundred million million lives will always attain these ten pure virtues.

source_sentence: 「若有至心聽此法門者，是人住如實際得於八種清淨功德。
translation: "If someone wholeheartedly listens to this teaching, that person abides in it as it actually is and attains eight kinds of pure virtues.

source_sentence: 何等為八？
translation: What are the eight?

source_sentence: 一者、長壽；二者、端正；三者、富貴；四者、名稱；五者、常為諸天守護；六者、所須常無所乏；七者、盡諸業障；八者、命欲終時有十方佛及諸大眾，放大光明照其眼目，令其人見得生善處。
translation: One, long life; two, correctness; three, wealth and prosperity; four, renown; five, always being guarded by gods; six, always having nothing to lose; seven, ending the karmic hindrances; and eight, when his life is about to end, having the buddhas and great multitudes of people in ten directions shine their light into his eyes, causing him to see and be born in a good place.

source_sentence: 於百千萬生，常得如是八種功德。
translation: In a hundred million lifetimes, they'll always attain these eight merits.

source_sentence: 「我今更復略說，是人當得十三種清淨功德。
translation: "Now, I'll also explain briefly that this person will attain 13 kinds of pure virtues.

source_sentence: 何謂十三？
translation: What are the thirteen?

source_sentence: 一者、生死流轉，終不更起顛倒惡見；二者、不生五濁無佛國土；三者、常得見佛；四者、常聞正法；五者、常得供養眾僧；六者、值善知識；七者、常與六波羅蜜相應；八者、不墮小乘；九者、常以大慈大悲大方便力成熟眾生；十者、常發勝願；十一者、乃至菩提而常不離如上等法；十二者、速能滿足六波羅蜜；十三者、於阿耨多羅三藐三菩提而成正覺。
translation: 1) He'll go through the cycle of birth and death and never again give rise to mistaken and bad views; 2) He won't be born in one of the five turbid lands without a buddha; 3) He'll always see the buddhas; 4) He'll always hear the right teaching; 5) He'll always be able to support the saṃgha; 6) He'll meet a good teacher; 7) He'll always be associated with the six perfections; 8) He won't fall into the lesser vehicle; 9) He'll always mature sentient beings with great kindness, great compassion, and the power of great skill; 10) He'll always give rise to a superior vow; 11) He'll reach enlightenment and never part from such things; 12) He'll quickly fulfill the six perfections; 13) He'll become fully awakened in the unsurpassed, correct, and complete enlightenment.

source_sentence: 若有受持、書寫、讀誦，為他解說，如說修行此月藏法門者，所得功德如前所說。」
translation: If someone accepts, writes, recites, explains, and teaches this moon-store dharma-gate for others as it's taught, they'll attain the merits as explained above."

source_sentence: 作是語時，月藏菩薩摩訶薩、尊者阿若憍陳如，及於一切諸來大眾、天人、阿修羅、乾闥婆等，一切眾生聞佛所說，皆悉歡喜頂戴奉行。
translation: When they said this, the moon-store bodhisattva Mahāsattva, Venerable Ājñāta Kauṇḍinya, and all the multitudes, gods, humans, asuras, and gandharvas who came, as well as all the sentient beings who heard what the Buddha taught, rejoiced and bowed their heads in approval.

source_sentence: 大集經卷第五十六
translation: Great Collection Sutra, Volume 56
